case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 10-day history of intermittent fevers and painful swelling of the right ankle. He has not had trauma to the ankle. He has a history of sickle cell disease and had an episode of dactylitis of his left index finger 3 years ago. Current medications include hydroxyurea and acetaminophen as needed for the ankle pain. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), blood pressure is 125/68 mm Hg, pulse is 105/min, and respirations are 14/min. Examination shows a tender, swollen, and erythematous right ankle with point tenderness over the medial malleolus. X-ray of the right ankle demonstrates marked periosteal thickening and elevation, as well as a central sclerotic lesion with a lucent rim over the right lateral malleolus. A bone biopsy culture confirms the diagnosis.
question: Which  is the most likely causal organism?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having intermittent fevers and my right ankle is really swollen and painful.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For about 10 days now.
Do you have any history of blood disorders or cancer?
Yes, I have a history of sickle cell disease.
Have you been taking any medications for your sickle cell disease? If so, please list them.
I've been taking hydroxyurea for my sickle cell disease.
Do you have any family history of blood disorders or cancer?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information about my family history of blood disorders or cancer to share.
**Final Diagnosis:** Sickle Cell Anemia with Avascular Necrosis of the Ankle Joint
